p:
Povidone-iodine (PVP-I) drops is another potential agent for the treatment of adenoviral conjunctivitis
16 . Studies investigating PVP-I in combination with topical steroids (0.1% dexamethasone) have shown a reduction in symptoms and viral titre in both humans and rabbit models.
17 ,
18 A recently published Phase 2 randomised controlled trial suggests some benefit of a combination treatment of PVP-I and dexamethasone in terms of speed of clinical resolution and adenoviral eradication, although this is not yet commercially available and the potential of significant steroid-induced side-effects has not been fully investigated.
